title: Weeping skull
data:

| - | ------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------ |
|   | An undead skull kept aloft by unholy clouds of collective misery, which slowly drift out in its wake. It mourns without end for the living, the dead, and its own former life all alike.***“Alas, poor Yorick! I knew him, Horatio, a fellow of infinite jest, of most excellent fancy. He hath bore me on his back a thousand times, and now how abhorr’d in my imagination it is! My gorge rises at it.” -William Shakespeare, \_The Tragedy of Hamlet, Prince of Denmark\_, V, 1. 1603. |

## Contents

- [1 Useful Info](#Useful_Info)
- [2 Spells](#Spells)
- [3 Tips & Tricks](#Tips_.26_Tricks)
- [4 History](#History)

## Useful Info

**Weeping skulls** can be found in [ossuaries](/Ossuary "Ossuary"), [Crypt](/Crypt "Crypt"), and [the Abyss](/The_Abyss "The Abyss"). They spew [clouds of excruciating misery](/Clouds#Excruciating_misery "Clouds"), harming the player for 10% of their health each turn without [negative energy resistance](/Negative_energy_resistance "Negative energy resistance"). They also produce an aura of short-lived misery clouds a few tiles around them.

## Spells

| Spell set I |                                                 |                                                      |
| :---------- | ----------------------------------------------- | ---------------------------------------------------- |
| Slot1       | [Mourning Wail](/Mourning_Wail "Mourning Wail") | [Magical flag](/Spell_slot_flags "Spell slot flags") |

## Tips & Tricks

- If you lack negative energy resistance, do not fight these in corridors. You will quickly lose all of your health over the course of a few turns.
- [Torment resistance](/Torment_resistance "Torment resistance") has no effect against clouds of excruciating misery.
- If you stay still, the misery clouds created from [Mourning Wail](/Mourning_Wail "Mourning Wail") can never hit you, as it will not spawn clouds on tiles with vulnerable targets. The clouds that randomly spawn around the weeping skull can, however.
- [Lee's Rapid Deconstruction](/Lee%27s_Rapid_Deconstruction "Lee's Rapid Deconstruction") will likely destroy these in 1-2 casts.

## History

- This monster was added in [0.31](/0.31 "0.31"), replacing [flying skulls](/Flying_skull "Flying skull").
html:
Weeping skull

From CrawlWiki
Jump to: navigation, search
Version 0.31: This article may not be up to date for the latest stable release of Crawl.
weeping skull z 
HP 18-38
HD 5
XP 98
Speed 10
AC 7
EV 3
Will 20
Attack1 10 (touch: drain experience)


Resistances rC+
rPois+++
rDrown
rMiasma
rN+++
rTorm
Vulnerabilities Holy
Habitat Land
Intelligence Human
Uses Uses nothing
Holiness Undead
Size Tiny
Type weeping skull, weeping skull
Flags Evil
Flying
Unbreathing
An undead skull kept aloft by unholy clouds of collective misery, which slowly drift out in its wake. It mourns without end for the living, the dead, and its own former life all alike.

“Alas, poor Yorick! I knew him, Horatio, a fellow of infinite jest, of most excellent fancy. He hath bore me on his back a thousand times, and now how abhorr’d in my imagination it is! My gorge rises at it.”
-William Shakespeare, _The Tragedy of Hamlet, Prince of Denmark_, V, 1. 1603.

Contents

  • 1 Useful Info
  • 2 Spells
  • 3 Tips & Tricks
  • 4 History

Useful Info

Weeping skulls can be found in ossuaries, Crypt, and the Abyss. They spew clouds of excruciating misery, harming the player for 10% of their health each turn without negative energy resistance. They also produce an aura of short-lived misery clouds a few tiles around them.

Spells

Spell set I
Slot1 Mourning Wail Magical flag

Tips & Tricks

  • If you lack negative energy resistance, do not fight these in corridors. You will quickly lose all of your health over the course of a few turns.
  • Torment resistance has no effect against clouds of excruciating misery.
  • If you stay still, the misery clouds created from Mourning Wail can never hit you, as it will not spawn clouds on tiles with vulnerable targets. The clouds that randomly spawn around the weeping skull can, however.
  • Lee's Rapid Deconstruction will likely destroy these in 1-2 casts.

History

  • This monster was added in 0.31, replacing flying skulls.
Retrieved from "http://crawl.chaosforge.org/index.php?title=Weeping_skull&oldid=78918"

rawPage:
{{version031}}
{{monster info}}

==Useful Info==
'''Weeping skulls''' can be found in [[ossuary|ossuaries]], [[Crypt]], and [[the Abyss]]. They spew [[clouds#Excruciating misery|clouds of excruciating misery]], harming the player for 10% of their health each turn without [[negative energy resistance]]. They also produce an aura of short-lived misery clouds a few tiles around them.

{{monster spells}}

==Tips & Tricks==
*If you lack negative energy resistance, do not fight these in corridors. You will quickly lose all of your health over the course of a few turns.
*[[Torment resistance]] has no effect against clouds of excruciating misery.
*If you stay still, the misery clouds created from [[Mourning Wail]] can never hit you, as it will not spawn clouds on tiles with vulnerable targets. The clouds that randomly spawn around the weeping skull can, however.
*[[Lee's Rapid Deconstruction]] will likely destroy these in 1-2 casts.

==History==
*This monster was added in [[0.31]], replacing [[flying skull]]s.
